meanings.definition: The simultaneous transfer of genetic material between two bacterial cells during transduction.
meanings.sent1: During cotransduction, genetic material is exchanged between bacterial cells at the same time.
meanings.sent2: Researchers observed cotransduction in the lab when genetic material was passed between two bacterial cells simultaneously.
meanings.sent3: The bacteria threw a cotransduction party, swapping genetic material like it was going out of style.
meanings.sent4: In the world of bacteria, cotransduction is like a genetic dance where information is shared between partners.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cotransduction can be visualized as a genetic relay race between bacterial cells.

meanings.definition: The process by which two or more genes are transferred together from one bacterial cell to another.
meanings.sent1: Two genes traveling together from one bacterial cell to another is an example of cotransduction.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied cotransduction and found that multiple genes can be transferred simultaneously between bacterial cells.
meanings.sent3: The genes decided to carpool during cotransduction to make the journey more fun and efficient.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic world, cotransduction is like a tandem bike ride where genes pedal together to reach a new cell.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained cotransduction as a genetic road trip where genes hitch a ride together to a different bacterial cell.
